meanings.definition: A person or organization that issues something, such as stocks or bonds.
meanings.sent1: The issuer of the new stocks was a well-known company in the market.
meanings.sent2: The issuer of the bonds promised a good return on investment.
meanings.sent3: The issuer of the stocks accidentally printed the wrong company name on them.
meanings.sent4: As the issuer of the bonds, they held the financial power in the market.
meanings.sent5: The issuer of the shares was known for their reliable investment opportunities.

meanings.definition: The act of issuing or sending out something.
meanings.sent1: The issuer of the press release made sure it reached all media outlets.
meanings.sent2: The issuer of the invitations sent them out well in advance.
meanings.sent3: The issuer of the newsletter accidentally included a funny typo.
meanings.sent4: The issuer of the commands had full control over the system.
meanings.sent5: The issuer of the warnings alerted everyone about the upcoming storm.
